tweets.text: The @InvasiveSp Floating Pennywort has been introduced from America. It can grow up to 20 cm a day & forms dense mats, disrupting the flow of water & the movement of animals. It also impacts the water temperature & dissolved oxygen levels, leading to fish deaths #PlantHealthWeek https://t.co/Ego9xtuyzB

There are a few things you can do to keep yourself safe before a flood. Make sure you turn your electrics off and pack a grab bag https://t.co/7Fcbgsz1Zq #floodaware @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/2qGUzrzPsx

@DaveThroupEA Thanks @DaveThroupEA but what planning objections have @EnvAgencyMids put in against intensive poultry/livestock units & anaerobic digesters where the plan for waste is spreading on fields & run off into small streams/rivers? The cause of pollution needs to be stopped at source.

tweets.text: We continue to reduce #flood risk during the pandemic by removing debris from rivers to protect the environment and communities https://t.co/ryqsKln1uQ

Working with our partners at the @EnvAgency & @DurhamCouncil  & with the assistance of the site owner, fire crews have today extinguished the remaining waste at the site of the Old Eldon Brickworks. Crews will be onsite until tomorrow. Thank you to residents for their patience https://t.co/NgHvWqC0od

@KevinsDoherty1 @OxfordCity @EnvAgency We've seen your tweets about this issue and have passed these over to the relevant teams here - thanks for getting in touch and raising your concerns. If you'd like to speak directly to someone here, let me know and I can arrange this for you. Thanks

tweets.text:
With shocking warnings of 86% of river water bodies failing to reach good ecological status, now more than ever we need to monitor and measure. 

Our regular water testing has been groundbreaking for us.

We are committed - but we can‚Äôt do it alone... https://t.co/6SUEIPVAJ9

@motoway @OxfordCity 
@EnvAgency human faeces and bottles of piss along with food waste are littering this site at Cherwell Valley services https://t.co/pW111olBS5

@Rushcliffe @NottsCC @andy_jones13 @HighwaysEMIDS @HighwaysEngland @EnvAgencyMids @MyNottingham @AskMyNottingham @H_S_E Once again parked on double yellow lines, blocking the path of the street cleaner that @Rushcliffe arranged to clean up the mess these workmen left on the pavement and road! https://t.co/KA7XZ8bPwf

@julesserkin @andyswalecliffe @NeilWhitstable @canterburycc Thanks @julesserkin. We sent an officer out yesterday. They confirmed very high oxygen levels which suggests some algal activity but no noticeable algae seen. Please report any further suspected pollution to our 24 hour incident hotline on 0800 807060.

@Rushcliffe @NottsCC @andy_jones13 @HighwaysEMIDS @HighwaysEngland @EnvAgencyMids @MyNottingham @AskMyNottingham @H_S_E Great to finally see a parking enforcement officer moving the vehicles this morning! However the workmen have still left heavy equipment blocking the pavement and road, with no safety equipment or warning signs. https://t.co/Fmxem1j6UP
Working together with NGO partners and government partners including the @EnvAgencyNW we can make a difference, the will is there.... https://t.co/k9wUIahgzX

@Rushcliffe @NottsCC @andy_jones13 @HighwaysEMIDS @HighwaysEngland @EnvAgencyMids @MyNottingham @AskMyNottingham @H_S_E Now there's 2 more vans parked on the double yellow lines opposite resident parking bays, effectively blocking the road during the school run. But I have to pay for a permit to be allowed to park near my own house. Absolute joke! https://t.co/EG2qFF036g

urls.title: Home - GB non-native species secretariat
urls.description: First published in 2008 and updated in 2015 the GB Invasive Non-native Species Strategy was developed to meet the challenge posed by invasive non-native species in Great Britain. This website provides tools and information for those working to support the strategy.

tweets.text:
It's #PlantHealthWeek! @EnvAgency is working towards eradicating Water Primrose which is invading ponds, lakes, wetlands & waterways. This @InvasiveSp was introduced to the UK as an ornamental aquatic plant & is now banned from sale. For more: https://t.co/5crRIhAQUW
#BePlantWise https://t.co/EcD3WeS2uf

tweets.text:
In 2019 over 1,500,000 hours worth of sewage was dumped into our rivers.

2020 every single river in England is polluted, NONE meet ‚ÄòGood‚Äô overall environmental status.
 
Meanwhile @EnvAgency‚Äôs CEO makes a speech about the NHS.

Fiddling while Rome burns.

https://t.co/ylCeEQVypm

We are asking people in Devon to ask tradespeople where they are taking your green waste? Please follow the advice in the link to stop fly-tipping #CleanDevon https://t.co/kxX28GBzfm https://t.co/v0zPggUrwC

@Countrymaned @EnvAgency @RibbleTrust @JackSpees @RibbleLife @JackPerksPhoto I‚Äôm not sure someone is missing the point. All that time and effort, collaboration and partnership working, 3 decades of it, all amounted to nothing. 

Not a single river in England reaches ‚ÄòGood‚Äô surface water status and yet some still clamour to repeat the same failed strategy.

.@EnvAgency river pollution report is much-needed ‚Äòwake-up call‚Äô for urgent environmental action, says Ribble Rivers Trust @RibbleTrust chief exec @JackSpees; read more on #TheCountryman website: https://t.co/rJkPLn1NyV
@RibbleLife @Feargal_Sharkey @JackPerksPhoto https://t.co/fDjT55IFBv

So what has @DefraGovUK, @Ofwat, @EnvAgency, @NaturalEngland, the water industry and cheating got to do with a Sex Pistols gig on the 14th Jan 1978 in San Francisco?

You're going to have to tune in tomorrow night to find out.

You know it makes sense.

https://t.co/JPSyolWS2R

@cacccricket obviously couldn't wait for the @EnvAgencyYNE to start cutting down trees on Rawcliffe Meadows SSSI York as they took down the fence and started the job themselves @NEYorksNLincs #ThatsNotCricket https://t.co/VLghdiWVR5

It appears I've been quoted in a letter to @thetimes today written by the chair of the @EnvAgency.
